     8  import (
     9  	"fmt"

    17  func TestLogLog(t *testing.T) {
    18  	// reset of static loggings logInstance object
    19  	output0 := stderrLogger.output
    20  	defer func() {
    21  		stderrLogger.output = output0
    22  		SetDebug(false)
    23  	}()
    24  
    25  	text1, textNewline, expectedLocation, _, writer, mockOutput := mocksLogStat()
    26  	stderrLogger.output = mockOutput
    27  
    28  	var actualSlice []string
    29  	var actual string
    30  
    31  	// Log
    32  	Log(text1)
    33  	actualSlice = writer.getData()
    34  	if len(actualSlice) != 1 || actualSlice[0] != textNewline {
    35  		t.Logf(".Log failed: expected: %q actual: %s", textNewline, quoteSliceLogStat(actualSlice))
    36  		t.Fail()
    37  	}
    38  
    39  	// Log with Location
    40  	SetDebug(true)
    41  	Log(text1 + "\n")
    42  	actualSlice = writer.getData()
    43  	if len(actualSlice) != 1 {
    44  		t.Logf("Log SetDebug: invocations not 1: %d", len(actualSlice))
    45  	} else {
    46  		actual = actualSlice[0]
    47  	}
    48  	if !strings.HasPrefix(actual, text1) {
    49  		t.Logf("Log SetDebug: no text1 prefix: %q", actual)
    50  		t.Fail()
    51  	}
    52  	if !strings.Contains(actual, expectedLocation) {
    53  		t.Logf("Log SetDebug: no location: actual: %q expected: %q", actual, expectedLocation)
    54  		t.Fail()
    55  	}
    56  	if strings.Index(actual, "\n") != len(actual)-1 {
    57  		t.Logf("Log SetDebug: newline not at end: actual: %q expected: %q", actual, expectedLocation)
    58  		t.Fail()
    59  	}
    60  }
    61  
    62  func TestInfoLog(t *testing.T) {
    63  	output0 := stderrLogger.output
    64  	defer func() {
    65  		stderrLogger.output = output0
    66  		SetSilent(false)
    67  	}()
    68  
    69  	text1, textNewline, _, _, writer, mockOutput := mocksLogStat()
    70  	stderrLogger.output = mockOutput
    71  
    72  	var actualSlice []string
    73  
    74  	// Info
    75  	Info(text1)
    76  	actualSlice = writer.getData()
    77  	if len(actualSlice) != 1 || actualSlice[0] != textNewline {
    78  		t.Logf(".Log failed: expected:\n%q actual:\n%+v", textNewline, quoteSliceLogStat(actualSlice))
    79  		t.Fail()
    80  	}
    81  	if IsSilent() {
    82  		t.Logf("SetSilent default true")
    83  		t.Fail()
    84  	}
    85  
    86  	// SetSilent
    87  	SetSilent(true)
    88  	if !IsSilent() {
    89  		t.Logf("SetSilent ineffective")
    90  		t.Fail()
    91  	}
    92  	Info(text1)
    93  	actualSlice = writer.getData()
    94  	if len(actualSlice) != 0 {
    95  		t.Logf("SetSilent true: Info still prints")
    96  		t.Fail()
    97  	}
    98  }
    99  
   100  func TestDebugLog(t *testing.T) {
   101  	output0 := stderrLogger.output
   102  	defer func() {
   103  		stderrLogger.output = output0
   104  		SetDebug(false)
   105  	}()
   106  
   107  	text1, textNewline, expectedLocation, _, writer, mockOutput := mocksLogStat()
   108  	stderrLogger.output = mockOutput
   109  
   110  	var actualSlice []string
   111  	var actual string
   112  
   113  	// Debug off
   114  	if IsThisDebug() {
   115  		t.Logf("IsThisDebug default true")
   116  		t.Fail()
   117  	}
   118  	Debug(text1)
   119  	actualSlice = writer.getData()
   120  	if len(actualSlice) != 0 {
   121  		t.Logf("Debug prints as default")
   122  		t.Fail()
   123  	}
   124  
   125  	// Debug on
   126  	SetDebug(true)
   127  	if !IsThisDebug() {
   128  		t.Logf("IsThisDebug ineffective")
   129  		t.Fail()
   130  	}
   131  	Debug(textNewline)
   132  	actualSlice = writer.getData()
   133  	if len(actualSlice) != 1 {
   134  		t.Logf("Log SetDebug: invocations not 1: %d", len(actualSlice))
   135  		t.FailNow()
   136  	}
   137  	actual = actualSlice[0]
   138  	if !strings.HasPrefix(actual, text1) {
   139  		t.Logf("Log SetDebug: no text1 prefix: %q", actual)
   140  		t.Fail()
   141  	}
   142  	if !strings.Contains(actual, expectedLocation) {
   143  		t.Logf("Log SetDebug: no location: actual: %q expected: %q", actual, expectedLocation)
   144  		t.Fail()
   145  	}
   146  }
   147  
   148  func TestRegexpLog(t *testing.T) {
   149  	output0 := stderrLogger.output
   150  	defer func() {
   151  		stderrLogger.output = output0
   152  		SetRegexp("")
   153  	}()
   154  
   155  	text1, textNewline, expectedLocation, regexpLocation, writer, mockOutput := mocksLogStat()
   156  	stderrLogger.output = mockOutput
   157  
   158  	matchingRegexp := regexpLocation
   159  	nonMatchingRegexp := "aaa"
   160  
   161  	var actualSlice []string
   162  	var actual string
   163  
   164  	// matching regexp
   165  	if err := SetRegexp(matchingRegexp); err != nil {
   166  		t.Logf("SetRegexp failed: input: %q err: %+v", matchingRegexp, err)
   167  		t.Fail()
   168  	}
   169  	Debug(textNewline)
   170  	actualSlice = writer.getData()
   171  	if len(actualSlice) != 1 {
   172  		t.Logf("matching regexp did not print 1: %d regexp input:\n%q compiled:\n%+v",
   173  			len(actualSlice),
   174  			matchingRegexp,
   175  			stderrLogger.infoRegexp)
   176  		t.Fail()
   177  	}
   178  	actual = actualSlice[0]
   179  	if !strings.HasPrefix(actual, text1) {
   180  		t.Logf("matching regexp: missing prefix: %q text: %q", text1, actual)
   181  		t.Fail()
   182  	}
   183  	if !strings.Contains(actual, expectedLocation) {
   184  		t.Logf("matching regexp: no location: actual:\n%q expected:\n%q",
   185  			actual,
   186  			expectedLocation)
   187  		t.Fail()
   188  	}
   189  	if strings.Index(actual, "\n") != len(actual)-1 {
   190  		t.Logf("matching regexp: newline not at end: actual: %q expected: %q", actual, expectedLocation)
   191  		t.Fail()
   192  	}
   193  
   194  	// non-matching regexp
   195  	if err := SetRegexp(nonMatchingRegexp); err != nil {
   196  		panic(err)
   197  	}
   198  	Debug(text1)
   199  	actualSlice = writer.getData()
   200  	if len(actualSlice) > 0 {
   201  		t.Logf("non-matching regexp did print: %d", len(actualSlice))
   202  		t.Fail()
   203  	}
   204  }
   205  
   206  type mockWriterLogStat struct {
   207  	lock sync.Mutex
   208  	buf  []string
   209  }
   210  
   211  func (w *mockWriterLogStat) Write(p []byte) (n int, err error) {
   212  	n = len(p)
   213  	w.lock.Lock()
   214  	defer w.lock.Unlock()
   215  	w.buf = append(w.buf, string(p))
   216  	return
   217  }
   218  
   219  func (w *mockWriterLogStat) getData() (sList []string) {
   220  	w.lock.Lock()
   221  	defer w.lock.Unlock()
   222  	sList = w.buf
   223  	w.buf = nil
   224  	return
   225  }
   226  
   227  func quoteSliceLogStat(sList []string) (s string) {
   228  	var s2 []string
   229  	for _, sx := range sList {
   230  		s2 = append(s2, fmt.Sprintf("%q", sx))
   231  	}
   232  	return strings.Join(s2, "\x20")
   233  }
   234  
   235  func mocksLogStat() (text1, textNewline, expectedLocation, regexpLocation string, writer *mockWriterLogStat, mockOutput func(n int, s string) (err error)) {
   236  	text1 = "abc"
   237  	textNewline = text1 + "\n"
   238  
   239  	// location text for this file
   240  	location := error116.NewCodeLocation(1)
   241  	expectedLocation = location.Short()
   242  	// remove line number since this changes
   243  	if index := strings.Index(expectedLocation, ":"); index == -1 {
   244  		panic(Errorf("error116.NewCodeLocation failed: %q", expectedLocation))
   245  	} else {
   246  		expectedLocation = expectedLocation[0:index]
   247  	}
   248  	regexpLocation = location.FuncName
   249  	writer = &mockWriterLogStat{}
   250  	mockOutput = func(n int, s string) (err error) {
   251  		if !strings.HasSuffix(s, "\n") {
   252  			s += "\n"
   253  		}
   254  		_, err = writer.Write([]byte(s))
   255  		return
   256  	}
   257  	return
   258  }
